body_html:
@soumith I got nvidia-docker running, thanks for the tips.

I ran your docker script above, and at least the warnings in THCBlas.cu, FusedRNNKernel.cu, VolumetricDilatedMaxPooling.cu, VolumetricAveragePooling.cu do appear (same are reported in #3807).

The errors don't happen though. I'll now check for differences in options passed to compiler.

So far the investigation gives:
The problem is with THCSGenerateCharType.h (real confirms to be int8_t)
On native platform, somehow THCTensor_(data)(state, values) (here) returns char*, and in docker it returns int8_t*. Any clue why?
body_text:
@soumith I got nvidia-docker running, thanks for the tips.
I ran your docker script above, and at least the warnings in THCBlas.cu, FusedRNNKernel.cu, VolumetricDilatedMaxPooling.cu, VolumetricAveragePooling.cu do appear (same are reported in #3807).
The errors don't happen though. I'll now check for differences in options passed to compiler.
So far the investigation gives:
The problem is with THCSGenerateCharType.h (real confirms to be int8_t)
On native platform, somehow  THCTensor_(data)(state, values) (here) returns char*, and in docker it returns int8_t*. Any clue why?
body:
@soumith I got nvidia-docker running, thanks for the tips.

I ran your docker script above, and at least the warnings in THCBlas.cu, FusedRNNKernel.cu, VolumetricDilatedMaxPooling.cu, VolumetricAveragePooling.cu do appear (same are reported in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/3807).

The errors don't happen though. I'll now check for differences in options passed to compiler.

So far the investigation gives:
The problem is with `THCSGenerateCharType.h` (`real` confirms to be `int8_t`)
On native platform, somehow  `THCTensor_(data)(state, values)` ([here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THCS/generic/THCSTensor.cu#L111)) returns `char*`, and in docker it returns `int8_t*`. Any clue why?
